Name: Banana Cow
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix)
Instructions: BLEND all ingredients with 12oz scoop crushed ice and serve with straws.
Review: Trader Vic writes of his drink, " the world's finest, greatest, oh-so good peachy hangover special. This'll do when nothing else will. " Perhaps Vic is somewhat overselling this malty banana meal of a drink.
History: Created by Victor J. Bergeron , this recipe is adapted from his 1948 Bartender's Guide... Trader Vic .
